tweets.text: Lovely to see our post-dredging beck today! Still more work to do but already the stream is looking more natural and the birds certainly looking more at home! @EnvAgencyYNE @georgenorman20 @Michael4HullRd @HullRoadWard @YorkLabourCllrs @YorkCVS @HullRoadPark https://t.co/LbvAstjYNS

@martr101 @FiDaisyG @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM And it was officers who have the talk?

@FiDaisyG @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM can't look at it, as nothing there. Is there a recording?
@PaulKingstonITV Shame they're not so fresh these days eh? @EnvAgency

@FiDaisyG @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM @CIWEM do you have a recording of this webinar please?

@martr101 @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM That was addressed @CIWEM  talk on Tuesday. Modelling showed a barrier would trap as much river water as the tide it tries to stem. Difficult choices as easy options don't work https://t.co/bJp3aEyBAa

@stillawake @martr101 @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM I don't know, but looking forward to studying detail once term ends.

And I do think we need neighbourhood partnerships back if we are to have a hope of developing community #FloodResilience implicit in national #FCERM strategy https://t.co/eNOSUCyb3t

@FiDaisyG @martr101 @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM What do you think would be the best option?

@FiDaisyG @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM is there a recording of this? I notice that it was sponsored by ARUP and @BristolCouncil so a cynic might say...........

@FiDaisyG @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM I'll have a look at this now. But the main risk is tidal surge, not fluvial flooding.

tweets.text:
We've started the demolition of Shade Chapel this morning, starting on the roof, to reduce flood risk to Todmorden.

Part of Rochdale Rd & Knowlwood Rd will be closed until 6am on Monday so we can do this safely. Diversions are in place. 

More info: 
https://t.co/kp3y70Xv4j https://t.co/hGz6dmXUB1

The latest emissions have just dropped from the polluting @ViridorUK #SLWP Beddington Incinerator üè≠

The VOC Volatile Organic Compounds figure is so high it's disappeared off the graph!

Breaking @EnvAgency permit conditions monthly, what is the point of limits IGNORED regularly https://t.co/tuLqpG8sNv

@FiDaisyG @stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE @EnvAgencySW @ICESouthWest @CIWEM it should be a downstream barrier. Not hundreds of thousands of tonnes of concrete, which appears to be what the council proposes.

@stillawake @TRESAcic @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE Silence definitely won't be heard. And at worst you will have specific questions to ask of those seeking election in May; At best you get your opinions considered by @BristolCouncil @EnvAgencySW and the @ICESouthWest @CIWEM  engineers they ask to develop concept designs

We want to thank our staff who attended a major fire in Bradford last week.

More than 40 of our frontline officers worked around the clock to stop contaminated water reaching nearby rivers.  

We also set up 2 air quality monitoring units to provide public health information. https://t.co/PmAPTqSa3E

@TRESAcic @FiDaisyG @Bristol_People @Totterdown_ @BristolCouncil @LabourBristol @nicolabeech @harbour_news @hccabristol @bgreencapital @GlobalSciShow @BathArchandCivE This is what I‚Äôm worried about.

Gaywood river üíÄüêüüí©this small Norfolk river enters the Great Ouse at Kings Lynn its free fishing for coarse fishing though readers are warned it was recently the subject of a severe pollution Bawsey to Kings Lynn free fishing ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è@Feargal_Sharkey @WestNorfolkBC @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/OlzkuCsBb6

A joint operation between @EnvAgency @DurhamPolice saw 3 suspected poachers detained on the River Wear at #Weardale #CountyDurham The enforcement operation was located in Escomb #BishopAuckland targeting rural crime and wildlife offending 
[story] https://t.co/HZdkuvtn6R #salmon https://t.co/OeU9D8BEt3

tweets.text:
The majority of Earth's chalk streams & rivers are found in England; fragile, extraordinary ecologies.
But they're dying from water company over-extraction, pollution & @EnvAgency inaction.
@Feargal_Sharkey is leading an event (8 Dec) on stopping the rot.
https://t.co/znRcXVS58x

@bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @Bradford_TandA @WYFRS @EnvAgency Silence.... @bradfordmdc can you confirm that you have formally reported this to @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE? If a similar issue was to occur at this site on Leeds Road as the recent #bradfordfire who would be responsible for the inaction in addressing it now?
@CazHumphreys @UKParliament @EnvAgency @cleanairdayuk @CleanAirUK @CPCB_OFFICIAL @pollution ??? I can run stuff in my car from the battery, without having the engine running.

Very kind letter (and gift!) from the project team delivering a ¬£35m upgrade at Keadby Pumping Station near #Scunthorpe

Since March, our construction sector has performed a vital role. I know it has been tough, but to workers across the country powering our recovery: thank you https://t.co/KeDJYUPeoo

tweets.text:
It is spawning time for #salmon on many of our rivers here in @EnvAgencyMids You may see very sick looking salmon after spawning these are known as #kelts 
These salmon are still protected & must not be removed, they will die & decompose which contributes food to river ecosystems https://t.co/Fh69g3FKiG

tweets.text:
üö® We need YOUR help in deciding the winner & two runners up from our annual employee Nature Focus photograph competition! üö® 

This year‚Äôs theme is pollinators! 

It‚Äôs been a tough job shortlisting the snaps to six & we want you to decide your top three (..Answers in comments)üíô https://t.co/FOINqBMbX4

This weir in Kidderminster town centre was a barrier to fish movements at low flows. In summer, with funding from @EnvAgencyMids and on behalf of our project, @SanctusLtd worked to remove a 'notch' from it, ensuring a passable flow of water at all times for all fish species. https://t.co/2l0oMcstTo

Most will probably be from @RoyalMail  posties and therefore counts as Trade Waste or littering at ¬£80 a pop. It is a national problem and costs RM money. @ScottishEPA @EnvAgency or councils should serve notice of intent to prosecute if not dealt with @ZeroWasteScot @scotgov. https://t.co/NEX5cblZ4U

We're demolishing Shade Chapel this weekend to reduce flood risk to Todmorden.

Part of Rochdale Rd & Knowlwood Rd will be closed from 8pm tonight until 6am on Monday so we can do this safely. Diversions will be in place. Please keep away from the site
https://t.co/kp3y70FTFJ https://t.co/blFAicAXTh

First salmon redds on the main Derbyshire Derwent recorded today, lower water levels and better clarity helped with the redd spotting #salmon #spawning @Trent_R_Trust @TrentGateway @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/TKbB8PNLMB

We are excited to announce that the fish and eel pass at Saltaire has been finished.

 We are now a major step closer to returning Salmon to the river Aire for the first time in 150 years. https://t.co/kUqW6LwbQO

#DNAire #AireRiversTrust #EnvironmentAgency #Riverrestoration https://t.co/AQ2gaooeMg
